content:
Hi all,

The definition of the _history interaction of the RESTful API says that: http://build.fhir.org/http.html#history

If the server does not populate response.status, it should ensure that only successful interactions appear in the history logs

The text describing the status field in http://build.fhir.org/bundle.html says

Status response code (text optional)

However, the cardinality of the status field is 1..1: http://build.fhir.org/bundle-definitions.html#Bundle.entry.response.status

How is this supposed to be after all? Is status optional or not? If so, how should it be represented in the empty case?
Hi @Gabriel Bezerra - that looks like something we need to fix in the spec. Can you submit a change proposal?
at the bottom of every page in the FHIR specification is a link "propose a change"
Ah, I see. Do you have an idea of what should be changed already? Should status be optional or should _history always provide status? I don't have a strong opinion in favour of any of them yet.
You should write it the way you would prefer to fix it, also make sure you explain the problem clearly. The committee will take your proposal as a starting point, and produce a consensus solution.
At this point, we're too late to change the cardinality for R4, but we might be able to clarify expectations
OK. I'll send it when my account is approved on GForge
